utility - get table with bgid for each blockid, or just unique bgid values vector

Source: R/utils_bgid_from_blockid.R
bgid_from_blockid.Rd

utility - get table with bgid for each blockid, or just unique bgid values vector

Usage

bgid_from_blockid(blockids, asdt = FALSE)

Arguments

blockids

vector of blockid values as in blockwts table or in testoutput_getblocksnearby_10pts_1miles

asdt

set to TRUE if you want it to return a data.table with colnames bgid, blockid, one row per input blockid, so it may have duplicates in the bgid column. set to FALSE if you want it to return a vector of bgid values (integer class)

Value

depends on asdt parameter value

Examples


rad = 0.658
pts = data.frame(lat=39.4347105, lon=-74.7203421)
s2b = getblocksnearby(sitepoints=pts, radius = rad)
#> Analyzing 1 points, radius of 0.658 miles around each.
#> Finding Census blocks with internal point within  0.658  miles of the site (point), for each of 1  sites (points)...
#> Stats via getblocks_diagnostics(), but NOT ADJUSTING UP FOR VERY SHORT DISTANCES: 
#> min distance before adjustment:  0 
#> max distance before adjustment:  0.9041917 
#> 
bgid_from_blockid(s2b$blockid) # vector of unique ids
#> Error in bgid_from_blockid(s2b$blockid): could not find function "bgid_from_blockid"
bgid_from_blockid(s2b$blockid, asdt = TRUE) # data.table
#> Error in bgid_from_blockid(s2b$blockid, asdt = TRUE): could not find function "bgid_from_blockid"

 # plotblocksnearby(pts, radius = rad, overlay_blockgroups = T)
